articles.title: Will global warming bring a change in the winds? Dust from the deep sea provides a clue: Westerlies moved poleward in the past, as they are doing now - Science Daily
articles.description: Climate researchers describe a new method of tracking the ancient history of the westerly winds--a proxy for what we may experience in a future warming world.
articles.content: The westerlies -- or westerly winds -- play an important role in weather and climate both locally and on a global scale, by influencing precipitation patterns, impacting ocean circulation and steerin… [+3466 chars]

articles.title: Asteroids bigger than Eiffel Tower approach Earth - ARY NEWS
articles.description: Though the size of the asteroids matters while calculating the risk, their speeds can greatly alter the level of threat.

articles.title: Researchers study a signal that is coming from the star Proxima Centauri - Firstpost
articles.description: Proxima Centauri, which is a red dwarf star is orbited by two known planets, one of which is in the 'habitable zone' that could support Earth-like conditions.
